title: Agricultural Experts: 'Joint efforts by pvt sector, govt needed to revive farm sector' | Coimbatore News - Times of India
text: Coimbatore: Agricultural experts emphasized on the need for the private sector and govt embarking on joint efforts to address the problems faced by the farm sector.Participating in the inaugural event of Agri Intex 2024, a five-day agri expo, on Thursday, Himanshu Pathak, secretary, Department of Agricultural Research and Education, said the technological support, adequate funding and policy intervention were essential elements to enable farmers to overcome their challenges.Pathak said the role of private sector in developing technologies was a vital one. He said the industry should work along with the public sector to conduct research, develop technology and ensure that the latest advancements reach farmers. He said govt institutions were also working towards this goal.Pathak noted that if farming needed to be sustainable and profitable, all the stakeholders should adapt to the changing scenario.Speaking at the event, vice-chancellor of Tamil Nadu Agricultural University V Geethalakshmi said TNAU was coming up with several initiatives to make farming profitable. She said the varsity was collecting farming data from all the blocks in Tamil Nadu. The data would be used to devise programmes to increase the revenue of farmers, she said.S V Balasubramanian, chairman, Bannari Amman Group, was also present at the inauguration.
